title: VA - Rough Guide to Voodoo - 2CD 2013
description:
Welcome to the spiritual rhythms of voodoo, brought by slaves from the religion's West African birthplace to its incarnations in Haiti (Voudou), Cuba (SanterÃƒÂ­a), Brazil (Candomble), Trinidad, and New Orleans. Grupo Vocal Desandann, Lord Nelson, Gangbe Brass Band, Maria Bethania and Dr John stand side-by-side in this unique take on voodoo's riveting musical history. (worldmusic.net)

- - -

VA - Rough Guide to Voodoo
(2CD World Music Network 2013)

 1. Grupo Vocal Desandann - Guide Nibo (Haiti/Cuba) 
 2. Lord Nelson - Shango (Trinidad)
 3. Dr John - Marie Laveau (USA)
 4. Gangbe Brass Band - Segala (Benin)
 5. Baden Powell And Vinicius De Moraes - Canto De Xango (Brazil)
 6. Bata Ketu - Osain/Osanyin (USA/Cuba/Brazil)
 7. Lazaro Ros & Olorun - Cantos Iyesa (Cuba)
 8. Toto Bissainthe - Dey (Haiti)
 9. Maria Bethania - Canto De Oxum (Brazil)
10. Conjunto Folklorico Nacional De Cuba - Yemaya (Cuba)
11. Steve Gray - New Orleans Funeral (USA)
12. Craig Klein feat. John Boutte - Marie Laveau (USA)

Bonus CD: 
Erol Josue - Regleman

Haitian singer Erol Josue is a practicing Vodou priest. His music explores the traditional rhythms that connect to the religion's rich history with a contemporary twist.
